intro: Ornithopus quadriphyllus, commonly known as the four-leafed oat grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and has a fibrous root system. Ornithopus quadriphyllus is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
